Detailed Description

Monte Carlo mode definitions.

Function Documentation

struct archive_spill** alloc_game_spills ( int  ndams,
int  nperiods 
) [read]

allocate storage for a game's worth of archive spill info.

an example of accessing data in this array is planned_spill = game_spills[dam][period].planned;

struct archive_header** get_and_check_archives ( struct monte_carlo_data *  monte_data,
long ****  ftells 
) [read]

Check flow archive files.

Returns:
a valid pointer to number of alternatives pointers to archive header structures if it could find and parse all the archive files appropriately, and returns a pointer to # of alternatives pointers to # of games in the appropriate alternative ftell pointers to locations of games in the archive through the ftells parameter, if successful, Zero if unsuccessful.
Note: some of these error messages should be made clearer.

int run_monte_carlo ( struct monte_carlo_data *  monte_data  ) 

The main shebang.

This function runs the monte carlo version of the model.

It cycles through the available alternatives, each alternative running the number of games and years contained in it. Much more to it than that, but this is only a comment.
